intro: Lasiocladus rufopilus, commonly known as the red-hair lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive orange to reddish thallus, which is covered in a dense layer of small, branched hairs. The lichen forms a crustose growth on rock surfaces, typically in arid or semi-arid environments. Its chemical composition includes usnic acid and other secondary metabolites, which contribute to its ecological role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling. This species is often used as an indicator of air quality due to its sensitivity to environmental pollutants.
